Mercury.description: The smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System. It has a very thin atmosphere and extreme temperature variations.

Venus.description: Similar in size to Earth, Venus has a thick atmosphere that traps heat, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.

Earth.description: Our home planet, the only known place with life. It has a breathable atmosphere and liquid water.

Mars.description: Known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface. It's a candidate for future human settlement.

Jupiter.description: The largest planet in the solar system with a massive magnetic field and the famous Great Red Spot.

Saturn.description: Known for its beautiful ring system, Saturn is a gas giant with dozens of moons.

Uranus.description: An icy giant that rotates on its side. It has faint rings and a bluish color due to methane.

Neptune.description: A distant, dark, and cold planet with strong winds and storms. It's the farthest known planet in our solar system.
